comment.author: 85888958@N03
comment._content: Their son, the 3rd and last Lord Lamington was a very good friend of my parents In Lamington, Lanarkshire, Scotland. One of his middle names was Brisbane. Would you know if he was actually born in Brisbane, or would Lady Lamington have "retired" back to UK for the birth of her two children, Victor and Grizel?

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: the entry for Lord Lamington in the Aistralian DIctionary of Biography records that Lord and Lady Lamington had leave in England in 1899-1900. Their son VIctor was born in 1896, and it is presumed that he was born in Brisbane. adb.anu.edu.au/biography/lamington-second-baron-7018 We'lll check the births, deaths and marriage records for that period and update you.

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/85888958@N03] Following on from our investigations I found an in depth article reporting the christening of Victor at St. John's Cathedral, Brisbane in September 1896. You can read the article here: CHRISTENING OF THE GOVERNOR'S SON. (1896, September 22). The Brisbane Courier (Qld. : 1864 - 1933), p. 5. Retrieved January 30, 2013, from nla.gov.au/nla.news-article3635268
